title: Risen Christ Between St. Andrew and St. Longinus
provenance_text:
M. Knoedler & Co., New York, NY; purchased by Kenneth Seaver [1877-1969], Pittsburgh PA and Oakmont, PA, on February 3, 1925 until December 8, 1948 [1]; his gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1948.

Notes:
[1]. Purchased for $900; see invoice dated March 2, 1925 (for purchases made on February 3, 1925) in curatorial file. See also a revised invoice from Knoedler, dated October 1, 1925, after returns of two other works that had also been purchased on February 3, 1925.
